dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 1528 RH: Veterinary Medicine Mobility Act of 2013
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Schrader (for himself, Mr. Yoho, Mrs. Hartzler, Mrs. Blackburn, Mr. Rodney Davis of Illinois, Mr. King of Iowa, Mr. Collins of New York, and Mr. Pierluisi) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

Additional sponsors: Mr. Farr, Mr. Ribble, Mr. Lucas, Mr. Peterson, Mr. Duncan of Tennessee, Mr. Kinzinger of Illinois, Mr. LaMalfa, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Mr. Harper, Mr. Rogers of Alabama, Mr. Reported from the Committee on Energy and Commerce with an amendment
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

action.action-desc: The Committee on the Judiciary discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To amend the Controlled Substances Act to allow a veterinarian to transport and dispense controlled substances in the usual course of veterinary practice outside of the registered location.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Veterinary Medicine Mobility Act of 2013 .

section.header: Transport and dispensing of controlled substances in the usual course of veterinary practice

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

Notwithstanding paragraph (1), a registrant who is a veterinarian shall not be required to have a separate registration in order to transport and dispense controlled substances in the usual course of veterinary practice at a site other than the registrant’s registered principal place of business or professional practice, so long as the site of dispensing is located in a State where the veterinarian is licensed to practice veterinary medicine.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Veterinary Medicine Mobility Act of 2014
.

section.header: Transport and dispensing of controlled substances in the usual course of veterinary practice

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

Notwithstanding paragraph (1), a registrant who is a veterinarian shall not be required to have a separate registration in order to transport and dispense controlled substances in the usual course of veterinary practice at a site other than the registrant’s registered principal place of business or professional practice, so long as the site of transporting and dispensing is located in a State where the veterinarian is licensed to practice veterinary medicine and is not a principal place of business or professional practice.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported from the Committee on Energy and Commerce with an amendment
The Committee on the Judiciary discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
